message.body: I deleted the old messages. Did you figure out how to message them?
Also I see you haven't deposited my checks yet. I can directly transfer it and the money will be in your account Thursday. Should i do that?
Eric did something then they all came in at once. Rick was gonna make dinner for mother's day but I didn't respond till late
Let u know about check
Is it more than one check?
Another should have come today for 150
The last one
Maybe tomorrow
I'll just transfer the money and you can throw out the checks
Oh, hmm, i can't do that... Yet.
I'll just deposit it tomorrow w ur fathers check
Ok
You've really got to put some of that in a money market account or some cds. You should be getting a little interest
I know. But I don't know how long I'll b around:-(
I asked Eric what he wants. A star wars. Video game a CD n wants to eat a Famous Dave's rest or would money b better
That's no reason to not have as much money as possible. I'll get the game, you get the cd, and i'll take us to dave's and we'll give him some money to boot.
We're eating the leftovers. Thank u for dinner
Yay
Good even the 2nd day
I really love the towels you got me.
Oh good. I have such a hard time picking for u. I have to go opposite of what I like lol
Hahaha
Are you avoiding me?
What why. I been in the backyard pulling weeds
Oh ok. I thought you somehow knew i wanted to talk to you about your money :-)
Oh lol
Can you send me your taxes?
How
N why
I'm trying to plan for you, i want to know how much you paid so i know how much to do to reduce them. Do you only have a printed copy?
Yesalthou he filed electronically I think. I wouldn't mind a CD but what good is a Ira for me. My life expentancy is not that long
Talk to u tomorrow. Im exhausted
Capital m
Wow, the department of commerce credit union has really high cd rates. I wish i could sneak you in.
Do you know how much social security dad gets? I want to figure out how much you would get when benefits kick in.
I. Think just a little over a 1000.00
At 62, you'd get 33.13 percent of that.

I'm thinking 4 things for you. 1. Putting 6 months of alimony payments in a money market account with a .84% interest rate. 2. Putting 6000 into cds, a third each in a 1, 2, and 3 year cd. That way some of it will be available every year, but you will

3. Put some in an ira, which you can access without penalty because a doctor will certify that you are totally and permanently disabled. We will put that in very safe and conservative bond index funds.
Putting money in the ira will save you as much as 1000 in taxes, or about 15 percent, which is the best return you will get anywhere.

4. Finally, the ira will be at fidelity. They have an excellent, rewards credit card. For every 2500 you spend, 50 gets put in your ira, a 2 percent return. If you use that for your shopping and what bills you can and pay it off at the end of the mont
Money magazine calls that fidelity card one of the best two best. They rate Ally bank tops for cds, so we will use them for that and the money market account.
You in?
(1/2) Wait till we discuss all this later. I still have to pay for my teeth. Have to pay rick for trees n have him fix kitchen floor in case I sell. Also hav
(2/2) e to replace front upper window. It has moisture in from not being taken care of. Going to b expensive. Can't leave it cuz it will cause more damage
Don't know what to do. Not sure I can afford this house. Stressing me out. I have to get thru this dental thing

Well, let's hold off on the ira part. If you spend more than 2500 on your teeth, that will be tax deductible, so you won't need it. Money is still accessible in the money market account and we can make the 1 year cd the no penalty one so it will be
My teeth r going to b in the thousands depending which way I go. I pray that something can b done w the board of examiners
I have a usaa credit card at 9.9% not good??
If you have to pay, pay all in one year if you can, could save you thousands.
Still paying on heat n air system. 0 % till Dec
Do u think I should just sell?? Eric I think would b upset
I'm not planning on you paying any interest, just getting the rewards. At usaa, you get 25 back for every 3000 you spend. Fidelity is 50 for every 2500.
I don't think you have to sell, and i think that the longer you wait, I he stronger the market gets and and the more prices go up.
(1/2) Oh wow. Why don't u become a CFA. U would be good n have the potential to make big bucks n then can afford to help ur mamma LOL. Actually there aren't t
(2/2) hat many in the country
I was thinking about it this past summer. There would be money in it. I'd have to work in finance for a few years before i could take the test. I got the study books.
Can i open the accounts? Just to get started. We don't have to put anything in them yet.
I guess so. Im not sure how much because of my teeth n window
I think u would find it interesting n challenging
